Allegory of Touch, Hearing and Taste

Title
Allegory of Touch, Hearing and Taste
Object type
Painting
Genre
Allegory
Date
1617-1618

176
Width (cm)
264
Support
Canvas
Collaborators
Frans Francken the Younger (1581-1642), Peter Paul Rubens (1577-1632)
Our attribution
Jan Brueghel the Elder
Other attribution authorities
Ertz 1979, #333, Honig database as Jan Brueghel the Elder and studio, Ertz 2008-10 as Jan Brueghel the Younger, Hendrick van Balen, and Frans Francken the Younger

333

Public

inv. #1404
Bibliography

Provenance
1623Belgium FlandersOne of 25 paintings sent from Flanders to Queen Isabel de Bourbon
1636Spain MadridIn the Alcázar "in the room where the king eats during the summer" (attributed to Rubens and Brueghel)
